body.p: The appendicular skeleton is associated with which function?

multiple_choice.choice: organizing the structural center of the body
all of the above are correct

response.feedback: Correct. We are able to move around in the environment and touch, push, pull and otherwise manipulate things using the bones of the appendicular skeleton.
Incorrect. Only one of the above is true of the appendicular skeleton.
Incorrect. The cranium, ribs and vertebrae protect most of the vital internal organs.
Incorrect. The axial skeleton ("axis" means "center") supports and protects the central portions of the body.

part.hint: The appendicular skeleton contains the bones of the arms and legs.
The appendicular skeleton does not contain major bones along the axis of the body.
